  3. Meall Buidhe (Glen Lyon)

Meall Buidhe (Glen Lyon)

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Meall Buidhe is a north-south ridge in an area of wide moorlands, though the Glas Choire on its eastern side does add some character. It is one of the easiest and quickest Munros to climb from Loch an Damh.

 You have not climbed Meall Buidhe (Glen Lyon).

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 932 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.96/5
Rating: 3.0/5 (114 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Meall Buidhe from Loch an Daimh

Other routes and challenges

As the route is fairly short, many combine the route above with that to Stuchd an Lochain on the other side of the glen.

It is possible to ascend Meall Buidhe from the Bridge of Gaur above Loch Rannoch, but this is a much longer approach.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels
